Platform.Title: Khodursky Lab E. coli B 4290 ORFs Microarray
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: 4290 amplified ORFs from primer pairs (from Sigma Genosys) were printed onto glass slides using a 16 tip robotic printer from 384-well microwell plates
Platform.Description: A microarray with 4405 spot features. Tip Configuration: Standard 16-tip

Column.Name: GENE_SYMBOL
Column.Description: Name of the gene represented by the sequence in the spot/feature

Column.Name: GENE_DESC
Column.Description: Description of the gene represented by the sequence in the spot/feature

Sample.Title: Ecoli_NOX+_balanced growth at OD 0.13

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli MG1655/pTrc99a (NOX+), Balanced growth OD 0.06 in M9 + salts
Channel.Characteristics: Escherichia coli MG1655/pTrc99a (NOX+), Balanced growth OD 0.06 in M9 + salts
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: Escherichia coli MG1655/pTrc99a (NOX+), Balanced growth OD 0.13 in M9 + salts
Channel.Characteristics: Escherichia coli MG1655/pTrc99a (NOX+), Balanced growth OD 0.13 in M9 + salts
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Balanced growth of Ecoli MG1655/pTrc99a(NOX+) in M9 + salts
Sample.Data-Processing: Normalized log (2) ratio of Cy5/Cy3, normalized using lowess

Series.Title: Balanced growth of Ecoli MG1655/pTrc99a(NOX+) at different growth rates
Series.Summary: Responses of Escherichia coli MG1655/pTrc99a(NOX+) grown at different growth rates in chemostat in M9 + salts NOX: NADH oxygenase converts NADH to NAD. Cells with NOX are able to recycle the excess NADH generated during rapid growth, leading to lesser accumulation of acetate Keywords: different growth rates in parallel
Series.Overall-Design: Escherichia coli MG1655/pTrc99a(NOX+) cells sampled at different growth rates ( 0.13,0.21,0.28,0.34,0.4 1/hr) vs balanced growth at 0.06 1/hr
